usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script lacks the 'sd_' prefix and does not use ShopDrawing specific patterns like '#Type E' or '_Entity[]'. It uses generic 'getPoint' for insertion and 'Display' methods to draw 2D lines and text, which function in both Model and Paper Space. It operates as a standalone utility for generating a bill of materials table rather than a component generator.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: None (Script is space-agnostic; typically used in Paper Space for BOMs)
requiredSettings: hsbLooseMaterialsUI.dll must exist in the hsbCAD Install Utilities folder
Valid catalog entry to provide initial properties
Interaction with external .NET UI to populate the internal _Map with 'ITEM[]' data

insertionFlow.promptOriginal: Select upper left corner of bill of material.

dialogs.trigger: On Insert (after point selection) or On Recalc (via context menu)
dialogs.title: ShowLooseMaterialsDialog

contextMenu.action: Opens the .NET dialog to edit or update the Bill of Materials data.

```json
{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Generates a dynamic Bill of Materials (BOM) table for miscellaneous (loose) construction items, allowing users to list, sort, and display material properties in the drawing layout.",
    "category": "Reporting / Annotation",
    "typicalUseCase": "Used in production drawings or layout plans to list screws, nails, bolts, insulation, plates, and other non-structural materials required for assembly, ensuring all necessary loose materials are documented."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "sDimStyle",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Defines the CAD Dimension Style applied to the text and line formatting of the table.",
      "validRange": "Any valid Dimension Style name currently loaded in the drawing.",
      "unit": "String (Style Name)",
      "affectsOutput": "Changes the font, text height, and arrow styles used for the table content based on the selected style definition."
    },
    {
      "name": "nColorLine",
      "technicalDefault": "-1",
      "businessMeaning": "Controls the color of the grid lines and the outer border of the BOM table.",
      "validRange": "AutoCAD Color Index (0-255) or -1 for ByBlock/Layer default.",
      "unit": "Color Index",
      "affectsOutput": "Visually changes the color of the table grid and outline."
    },
    {
      "name": "nColorHeader",
      "technicalDefault": "-1",
      "businessMeaning": "Controls the text color for the column title row (e.g., 'Article', 'Width', 'Height').",
      "validRange": "AutoCAD Color Index (0-255) or -1.",
      "unit": "Color Index",
      "affectsOutput": "Visually changes the color of the header text."
    },
    {
      "name": "nColorGroup",
      "technicalDefault": "-1",
      "businessMeaning": "Controls the text color for rows that indicate a new group/category of materials.",
      "validRange": "AutoCAD Color Index (0-255) or -1.",
      "unit": "Color Index",
      "affectsOutput": "Visually distinguishes group separator rows from standard data rows."
    },
    {
      "name": "nColorContent",
      "technicalDefault": "-1",
      "businessMeaning": "Controls the text color for the actual data values (material list content) in the table.",
      "validRange": "AutoCAD Color Index (0-255) or -1.",
      "unit": "Color Index",
      "affectsOutput": "Visually changes the color of the item data rows."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowArticleHSB",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the internal hsbCAD Inventory Number (Article HSB) column.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Article HSB' column from the generated table."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowArticleNr",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the Supplier or Manufacturer Article Number column.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Article Number' column from the generated table."
    },
    {

      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the item description text.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Description' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowMaterial",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the material specification (e.g., Steel, Timber grade).",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Material' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowHeight",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the item's height dimension.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Height' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowWidth",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the item's width dimension.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Width' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowThickness",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the item's length (for timber) or thickness (for sheet materials/plates).",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Length/Thickness' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowLabel",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of a user-defined label or identifier for the item.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Label' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowFunction",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the usage or function description (e.g., 'Wall connection').",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Function' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowUnits",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the unit of measure (e.g., 'm', 'pcs', 'kg').",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Units' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowQuantity",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the required quantity or count.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Adds or removes the 'Quantity' column."
    },
    {
      "name": "sSortKey",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Determines which data column is used as the primary sorting key for the list.",
      "validRange": "List of available column names (Article HSB, Article Number, Description, etc.)",
      "unit": "String (Enum)",
      "affectsOutput": "Reorders the rows in the BOM table based on the selected property (e.g., sorts all items by size or material type)."
    },
    {
      "name": "sSortMode",
      "technicalDefault": "Ascending",
      "businessMeaning": "Determines the direction of the sort order.",
      "validRange": "Ascending, Descending",
      "unit": "String (Enum)",
      "affectsOutput":

workflowDiagram: Script loaded and Properties initialized from catalog
Check if catalog entry exists for current execute key
Prompt user: 'Select upper left corner of bill of material'
Store output Map in internal script variable (_Map)
Read item data from Map into arrays (Dimensions, Text, Quantities)
Calculate Sort Keys based on 'Sort column' and 'Sort mode' properties
Execute Bubble Sort algorithm on data arrays
Iterate through sorted rows to draw Content
Draw Group Row or Item Row based on Group logic
Draw Row Horizontal and Vertical Lines
Export data attributes to DXA (HSBARTICLENUMBER, HSBQUANTITY, etc.)

validationRules.errorMessage: Warning reported: 'Increase maximum quantity in TSL.'
validationRules.recovery: Script continues, but sorting string padding may be incorrect for very large numbers.

postInsertionActions.effect: Reopens the .NET dialog, allowing the user to modify the list of items, quantities, or properties. The map is updated and the table redraws upon confirmation.
Re-renders the entire table at the new origin point.
Changing properties like 'Sort column', 'Show description', Colors, or Alignment immediately triggers a script recalculation and redraws the table with the new formatting.

data.markdown:
# hsb_LooseMaterials.mcr

## Overview
Generates a dynamic Bill of Materials (BOM) table for miscellaneous (loose) construction items, allowing users to list, sort, and display material properties such as screws, nails, insulation, and plates directly in the drawing layout.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Can be placed in model space for 3D context. |
| Paper Space | Yes | Typically used here for production drawings and layout plans. |
| Shop Drawing | No | This is not a shop drawing script. |

## Prerequisites
- **External DLL**: The file `hsbLooseMaterialsUI.dll` must exist in the hsbCAD Install Utilities folder.
- **Catalog Entry**: A valid catalog entry is recommended to load default properties, though not strictly required to run the script.
- **No Entities Required**: You do not need to pre-select beams or elements; this script manages its own data.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` (or your company shortcut for inserting tsl scripts)
1. Run the command.
2. Browse and select `hsb_LooseMaterials.mcr`.

### Step 2: Set Table Origin
```
Command Line: Select upper left corner of bill of material.
Action: Click in the drawing (Model or Paper Space) where you want the top-left corner of the table to appear.
```

### Step 3: Configure Materials
1. Immediately after selecting the point, the **Loose Materials** dialog window appears.
2. Use the dialog to add items (e.g., "Screw 5x120"), define quantities, and set attributes (Material, Width, Height, etc.).
3. Click **OK** to generate the table.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| **Dimension style** | String | (Empty) | Sets the text style and dimension format for the table based on existing CAD styles. |
| **Line color** | Number | -1 | Sets the color index for the grid lines and table border (-1 = ByBlock). |
| **Text color: Header** | Number | -1 | Sets the text color for the column title row. |
| **Text color: Groups** | Number | -1 | Sets the text color for group/category separator rows. |
| **Text color: Content** | Number | -1 | Sets the text color for the standard item rows. |
| **Show article HSB** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the internal hsbCAD inventory number column. |
| **Show article number** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the supplier/manufacturer article number. |
| **Show description** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the item description column. |
| **Show material** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the material specification column. |
| **Show height** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the item height. |
| **Show width** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the item width. |
| **Show length/thickness** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the item length or thickness. |
| **Show label** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of a user-defined label column. |
| **Show function** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the usage function description. |
| **Show units** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the unit of measure (e.g., pcs, m). |
| **Show quantity** | Dropdown | No | Toggles visibility of the quantity/count column. |
| **Sort column** | Dropdown | (First) | Determines which property is used to sort the list (e.g., by Material, Description, Quantity). |
| **Sort mode** | Dropdown | Ascending | Sets the sort order to Ascending or Descending. |
| **Align header** | Dropdown | Center | Sets the horizontal alignment for the header text (Left, Center, Right). |
| **Align content** | Dropdown | Center | Sets the horizontal alignment for the data rows. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| **Update Loose Materials** | Reopens the .NET dialog, allowing you to add, remove, or edit items in the list. The table will automatically update to reflect changes upon confirmation. |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: `hsbLooseMaterialsUI.dll`
- **Location**: `hsbCAD Install Utilities` folder.
- **Purpose**: Provides the user interface form for data entry.

## Tips
- **Modify Columns Quickly**: You can show or hide specific columns (like "Width" or "Function") directly from the Properties Palette without reopening the dialog.
- **Moving the Table**: Select the table and use the standard AutoCAD grip points to move it. The script will regenerate the geometry at the new location.
- **Sorting**: To group all similar materials together (e.g., all nails), change the **Sort column** property to "Description" or "Material".
- **Units**: If your drawing is set to Imperial, the script automatically converts metric dimensions (mm) to inches for the display.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why did my table disappear?**
  - A: If the script detects no data in the internal map (e.g., if the external dialog was cancelled during creation), it erases itself. Try running the command again and ensure you confirm the dialog.
  
- **Q: Can I change the font size of the table?**
  - A: Yes. Select the table, open the Properties Palette, and change the **Dimension style** to a style that uses your desired text height.

- **Q: How do I fix incorrect quantities?**
  - A: Right-click the table and select **Update Loose Materials**. Edit the quantities in the list and click OK.
